title_sort: thomas jefferson whitman to walt whitman, 14 july 1888
title: Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Walt Whitman, 14 July 1888
text: Milwaukee,July 14th 1888My dear WaltI was very very glad to get a letter from you yesterday. I have been quite worried about you, wondering how things were going  I am more than glad to hear that you are holding your ownI am up here on a question of the disposal of the sewage of the city  Davis and Flad are associated with me and we have been confabing[confabbing] about a week—Yesterday they went away—leaving me here to make surveys etcI am going down to Chicago in the morning to meet some people—will be back here on WednesdayI hope dear Walt that you are gaining again—I was very sorry that I could not get back to Camden—but I had to go with my Committee to LouisvilleYours affectionately Jeff Thomas Jefferson Whitman to Walt Whitman, 14 July 1888
